application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description: Redevelopment to provide two 3 storey town houses and a three storey apartment building with ten flats to the front of the site; two 3 storey mews cottages to the rear of the site, new access points and parking (Outline application seeking approval for siting, external appearance, design and means of access)
decision_conditions: Approval of details of the landscaping, including surfacing (called the "reserved matters") shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced.  REASON: The application is in outline form only and is not accompanied by full detailed landscape plans, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Plans and particulars of the reserved matters for the development referred to in condition 1 above, relating to the landscaping of the site, shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority and shall be carried out as approved.  Reason: To ensure that no part of the development commences until reserves matters are approved. This condition reflects the provisions of Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act and Article 4 of the Town and Country (General Development Procedure) Order 1995 in accordance with Unitary Development Plan policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Application for the approval of all the reserved matters shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the reserved matters to be approved, whichever is the later.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed prior to occupation of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON:	To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for a scheme for protecting sensitive rooms from external noise and vibration to meet the Authority's criteria.  The details shall also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation for sensitive rooms, in accordance with the Authority's criteria.  The details as approved shall be completed before first occupation of the development and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON: To protect the amenities of future residents and occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5. of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and vibration'. | The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the methodologies detailed in the approved 'arboricultural method statement and tree protection plan' report received 19 June 2006 and 'tree protection site layout plan (FD/004/094/P204 Rev D)' received 19 June 2006, and where applicable, these methodologies shall be implemented for the duration of the construction period. .   REASON: To ensure that the neighbouring TPO Sycamore trees are suitably protected in the interests of the visual and landscaped amenity of the area, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | An arboricultural report shall be submitted upon completion of the excavation works for foundations and at the end of construction confirming that the root protection zones of the southern and western boundary Sycamore Trees as defined by BS5837: 2005 have been suitably protected.  If a breach of these zones has occurred, details of mitigation measures to ensure that the long term health of trees is not compromised shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and such measures shall be implemented as apporoved and maintained permamnently thereafter.   REASON: To ensure that the long term health of the neighbouring TPO Sycamore trees is provided for in the interests of the visual and landscaped amenity of the area, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of pedestrian and vehicular visibility splays (that measure 1.5m x 1.5m at either side of the access with no obstruction above 0.6m in height) and other highway safety measures at the entrance to the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development and such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units and thereafter permanently retained.   REASON: In the interest of Highway safety, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan. | The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan FD/004/094/P204 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan. | The cycle parking area shown on the approved plan FD/004/094/P208 shall be fully constructed before first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for cycle parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for cycle parking within the site, in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan. | The refuse storage area shown on the approved plan FD/004/094/P208 shall be fully constructed before first occupation of any part of the development, and this area shall be kept continuously available for refuse and recycling storage and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for refuse and recycling storage within the site, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan. | Notwithstanding the provisions of  the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no part of the houses hereby approved shall be extended nor any outbuildings constructed within the curtilige of the site without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:	To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, which would be contrary to policies 1.5, 4.5 and 5.1 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan. | Prior to commencement of development, details of the design of the building and its associated facilities demonstrating compliance with the requirements of Secure By Design shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of adjoing occupiers and prospective occupiers of the development, in accordance policy 4.4 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 'Safer Ealing'. | Before any works commence on site, a detailed soil survey shall be carried out and submitted to the Local Planning Authority.  Any remedial measures that are identified as a result of the survey shall be carried out before development commences and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 2.7 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan.   REASON:  To prevent pollution of the immediate environment, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan policy. | The existing access to the site shall be permanently closed before any part of the development permitted is occupied or brought into use; and the footway along Acton Lane shall be reinstated, and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:	In the interests of  highway safety and the visual amenity of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of the adopted Unitary development Plan. | Details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the details approved shall be so implemented prior to first occupation of any of the buildings in the development and perm maintained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the buildings are acceptable in terms of the Local Planning Authority's energy policies, in accordance with adopted Policy 2.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units shall be constructed as approved and retained as such permanently thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   REASON: To ensure compliance with Lifetime Homes and Wheelchair Housing standards, in accordance with policy 5.3 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
